Comments: Although they're linked because they're both directly referencing the Aarhus convention and the date of its singing, not sure how useful of a link this would actually be to make.
Although the parts of the act referenced are different, it is discussing the extent to which 2003/4/EC was vague and the extent to which the directive was a domestic or European Law issue.
While it's linked, isn't referencing the same articles or commenting on the specifics of the public interest. So, somewhat tenuous.
text says "accurate approach", but this is actually "aggregate approach" in audio.
This is talking about the public interest in disclosure and the rationale behind it.
References the minority view, which focuses on the intention of the directive.
This is indirectly referring to the interest in public disclosure
Director should be "directive", is refering to the interpretation of council direction 2003/4/EC.
Sweden v Turco is an EU Law case focusing on public interest and council disclosure of information on these grounds.
